business.headline: ICICI Bank hikes minimum savings balance to Rs 50,000: What it means for youThe change applies to all new accounts opened after that date, setting a new benchmark in the industry for the highest MAB requirement among domestic banks.

Ease of doing business: Piyush Goyal resolves Swiss firm's land issue in hoursUnion Minister Piyush Goyal resolved a complex land allocation issue for a major Swiss company during a live business conference, highlighting the ease of business in India.

Trump's tariff war: Is this India's 1991 moment? Montek Singh Ahluwalia exclusiveAt the Business Today India@100 Summit, Montek Singh Ahluwalia, former Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission, discusses if the 2025 Trump tariff war presents a 1991-like moment for India.

Piyush Goyal exclusive: Whole world recognises India as fastest-growing economyUnion Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the Indian economy and said the whole world recognises us as the fastest-growing large economy.

'A win for India': Piyush Goyal on clinching UK free trade dealUnion Minister Piyush Goyal, speaking at the Business Today India@100 Summit, called the India-UK free trade deal a big win for the country.

Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

Sensex cracks below 80,000 as tariff fears rattle stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 765.47 points to close below the psychological 80,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 232.85 points to settle at 24,363.30. Midcap and smallcap stocks witnessed deeper cuts, reflecting growing investor unease over the evolving global trade scenario.

India not a dead economy, poised to become 3rd-largest in world: Amitabh KantAfter Donald Trump's 'dead economy' jibe, Amitabh Kant calls India a resilient, reform-driven powerhouse on track to become the world's third-largest economy.

US tariff surge could stall India's manufacturing momentum, warns Moody'sOn Thursday, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that adds a 25% tariff on Indian goods. This move comes in response to India's continued import of oil from Russia.

How much will India's fuel bill rise if it stops buying oil from Russia?Russia currently provides 10% of the world's crude supply. If multiple countries stop buying from Russia at once, crude oil prices could rise by around 10%, as per the report. That would affect everyone, not just India.
Gold hits record high of Rs 1.02 lakh. Is it the right time to buy?The rally in gold comes amid growing concerns over new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.

Arvind Panagariya bets on these states to leads India's growth by 2047Arvind Panagariya explained that India doesn't need to push growth artificially. He believes market forces are already at work, shaping the country's growth naturally.

entertainment.headline: I'll never make films to sway people: John Abraham on his creative stand with TehranActor John Abraham discussed the challenges of censorship in Indian cinema, emphasising the delicate balance between creative freedom and regulatory oversight. He shared his journey with the film 'Tehran', highlighting the political sensitivities filmmakers face.

Milind Soman's 86-year-old mother nails skipping, fans call it incredibleMilind Soman shared a video of his 86-year-old mother Usha skipping rope with him and wife Ankita Konwar, leaving fans amazed. People called her "truly incredible" and praised her for staying active with daily skipping and yoga.

Raksha Bandhan 2025: Riddhima Kapoor to Sanjay Dutt, celebs extend wishesOn Raksha Bandhan 2025, celebrities from across the film and TV industry celebrated the festival by sharing heartfelt wishes and photos with their siblings on social media.

Mahesh Babu turns 50: Jr NTR, Chiranjeevi, celebs wish actor on milestone birthdayMahesh Babu celebrated his 50th birthday on August 9, with fans and celebrities flooding social media with love and wishes. Actors like Jr NTR, Chiranjeevi, and Gopichandh Malineni praised the Tollywood icon for his talent, humility, and inspiring journey.

SSMB29: Rajamouli shares Mahesh Babu's 1st look, full glimpse to release in NovemberAn official update on Mahesh Babu and SS Rajamouli's 'SSMB29' is out. On Babu's 50th birthday, the makers shared the first glimpse from the highly-awaited Telugu film.

Across genres, through hearts: How British films, shows are finding their momentBritish content has gone from niche to global hit - thanks to its sharp writing, dry humour, and deeply relatable themes. From binge-worthy dramas to clever comedies, the content is striking a chord with viewers globally.

Sidharth Malhotra, Janhvi Kapoor dazzle in ivory-gold at Gaurav Gupta's bridal debutSidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor mesmerised at Gaurav Gupta's bridal couture launch on Friday. The duo stunned as showstoppers in regal ivory and gold ensembles.

Sholay@50: RD Burman's Beer Bottles and Whistles Crafted an Iconic ScoreBlending Indian and Western musical elements with ease, RD Burman experimented with unconventional instruments like coconut shells and beer bottles. The result wasn't just a film score. It was music that helped turn Sholay into a cinematic legend.

Vivek Agnihotri reacts to Anurag Kashyap's liar remark: 2-3 people live inside himFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has responded to Anurag Kashyap's allegations, addressing their long-standing professional differences with a mix of criticism and respect. He also backed his past claims about the latter's ''drinking habits''.

Hrithik Roshan's pool workout video has fans gushing over his sculpted bodyHrithik Roshan has shared a behind-the-scenes glimpse of his disciplined training regime for his upcoming film 'War 2'. The unfiltered video has got fans gushing over his chiselled body.

Swara Bhasker slams troll over casteist, classist jibe at husband Fahad AhmadActor Swara Bhasker strongly reacted to a troll for his derogatory remarks about her husband Fahad Ahmad. She emphasised the classist nature of the slur in her response.

Sooraj Barjatya on Salman Khan's return as Prem: Script must be age-appropriateDirector Sooraj Barjatya hinted at actor Salman Khan's return as Prem in Rajshri Productions' future project. He opened up on working on an age-appropriate script for Salman.

Udaipur Files released after long legal battle, audience call it mirror to societyUdaipur Files has been released nationwide after legal hurdles. The film highlights societal silence and calls for justice in the Kanhaiyalal murder case.

Fan pays tribute to Rajinikanth with 5,500 posters at temple dedicated to superstarA fan of actor Rajinikanth's celebrated the superstar's 50 years in cinema in a unique way. He decorated a temple with thousands of posters as a tribute to the 'Coolie' actor's legacy.
Here's how BTS fans realised J-Hope, Jimin and V had been drinkingCurrently in Los Angeles, the BTS members enjoyed a day out at an upscale restaurant, though Jungkook and Jin were notably absent.

AI in filmmaking: Innovation or a threat to creative freedom?Artificial Intelligence is shaping the present phase in films. If used transparently, these tools can be a boon that helps in streamlining pre-production, improving accessibility, and even pushing artistic boundaries.

BLACKPINK still in your area: 9 years on, the band reigns supreme in K-pop sceneBLACKPINK celebrates nine years of redefining K-pop with record-breaking achievements. Their upcoming album and continued global tours hint at sustained dominance and evolving artistry.

Malti crashes Nick's rehearsals, Priyanka celebrates early Rakhi in new photo dumpPriyanka Chopra shared a photo dump featuring all the memorable moments of her family. The carousel featured her daughter Malti enjoying her time at beach and crashing into the Jonas Brothers' rehearsal.

Smriti Irani reacts to Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot topping TV, OTT chartsActor-politician Smriti Irani is elated as her show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot is topping the ratings. Irani expressed her gratitude to fans and viewers for their love and support.

general news.headline: 6 Pak jets shot down in Operation Sindoor: Air Force chief's big revealThis is the first time that any official of the armed forces has publicly revealed the number of Pakistani fighter jets shot down by India during Operation Sindoor in May.

2 soldiers killed in gunfight with terrorists in J&K as Op Akhal enters day 9Two soldiers were killed and four others injured in an overnight gunfight in Kulgam as Operation Akhal continues in south Kashmir.

Used cooking oil to power jet engines, so fry hardIndian Oil's Panipat refinery has been crowned the country's first to pump out sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) from used cooking oil. Your pakoda oil may now get a second life as rocket juice for a 747.

Rodri sidelined for Manchester City until mid-September after injury setbackManchester City will start their Premier League campaign without Rodri, as Pep Guardiola confirmed the midfield star faces another injury layoff, ruling him out until at least mid-September after a setback at the Club World Cup.

Arjun Erigaisi is held to a draw by Jorden van Foreest as Nihal Sarin splits points with Anish Giri.

Nawaz guided his side home as Pakistan secured a five-wicket win in the end.

DRS: Should Jasprit Bumrah be allowed to pick and choose matches?Jasprit Bumrah is a crucial pillar of India's bowling attack, but allowing him to pick and choose matches could disrupt team balance and increase pressure on other pacers. Data shows that Bumrah has struggled with injuries and workload management, so a structured rest plan is vital rather than an ad-hoc approach. A consistent, well-managed schedule can help maintain his fitness and effectiveness over the long term.

Nat Sciver-Brunt scripts history, becomes first-ever batter with 1000 runsThe Hundred: England skipper Nat Sciver-Brunt scripted history after becoming the first-ever player to reach the 1000-run landmark. She achieved the landmark in the match against Birmingham Phoenix at Edgbaston in Birmingham.

Australia confirms Mitch Marsh and Travis Head as T20I openers till 2026 World CupMitchell Marsh, Australia's T20I captain, revealed on Friday that he and swashbuckling opener Travis Head, the ICC's No.2-ranked T20I batter, will remain the team's first-choice opening pair until the ICC Men's T20 World Cup next year.

Australia name two Indian-origin players for U19 series against IndiaAustralia have picked two Indian origin cricketers Aryan Sharma and Yash Deshmukh for their U19 series against India, starting September 21.

Manchester United's unveil newly re-developed Carrington Training complexManchester United have unveiled their redeveloped men's first-team building at Carrington, a project funded through Jim Ratcliffe's £300 million investment.

PV Sindhu lone Indian seed at World Championships in ParisPV Sindhu is the only Indian singles player seeded at the 2025 World Badminton Championships in Paris. The tournament faces a setback as Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen withdraws due to injury concerns.

Priyansh Arya becomes first player to hit multiple hundreds in DPLPriyansh Arya roared back to form in the Delhi Premier League (DPL) 2025 with a blistering 111 off 56 balls for Outer Delhi Warriors against East Delhi Riders on Friday, 8 August.

IPL trade rules explained: Player exchanges, all-cash deals and moreThe IPL trading window could see some high-profile moves ahead of the 2026 season with two Indian stars rumoured to make a switch. Let us take a look at the rules regarding the trading period.

Who is Victoria Mboko? 18-year-old sensation shines with Canadian Open title18-year-old Victoria Mboko won the Canadian Open title after beating  four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka 2-6, 6-4, 6-1 in the final on Thursday, August 7.

Who is Haider Ali? Once Pakistan's U19 World Cup star amid criminal investigationYoung Pakistan batter Haider Ali has been suspended by the Pakistan Cricket Board after he was arrested last month in Manchester during the Pakistan Shaheens' tour of England.

IPL 2026: R Ashwin in talks with CSK over future, may join new franchiseFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, who was signed by the Chennai Super Kings in the mega auction ahead of the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) season, is currently in discussions with the five-time champions regarding his future with the franchise.

Virat Kohli begins training for ODI comeback in London, IPL coach joins himVirat Kohli has begun practising for his return to ODI cricket in London. The former captain is set to play for India in a three-match ODI series in Australia from October 19 to 25.

Croatia's Zach Vukusic becomes historic youngest-ever international captainZak Vukusic made history on Thursday after becoming the youngest captain in international cricket. He broke the record of France's Noman Amjad, who held the record earlier at 18 years and 24 days.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
